DataElement.preferredDefinition: A grouping category to denote whether the protocol entry criterion being assessed is Inclusion Criteria or Exclusion Criteria.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Category for Inclusion And Or Exclusion Terminology Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Category for Inclusion And Or Exclusion within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: IECAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: These categories have been pre-defined in SDTM and have controlled terminology that must be used. Only records for criteria that are not met appear in the IE SDTMIG domain. IECAT must be populated. This criterion category may be collected on the CRF in a checkbox format or it may be included as part of the Criterion Identification and mapped when the SDTM Submission datasets are created.
